com.wiris.quizzes.api

Interface AuthorAnswer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface AuthorAnswer
extends Serializable
    This class represents the criteria that will used to check if the student's answer is correct or not. Contains a correct value of the answer, a comparison assertion, the weight (grade assigned to this answer when correct) and may contain some additional validation assertions.
    Since:
    4.0.0.
    See Also:
    Question, Slot

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Validation addNewValidation(ValidationName name)
      Adds a new validation assertion that the student's answer has to fulfill in order to be correct.
      Comparison getComparison()
      Gets the comparison assertion that is to be used to compare the student's answer to getValue().

      Get the validation assertion for a given validation type.
      Validation[] getValidations()
      Gets the additional validation assertions that the student's answer must fulfill to be correct.
      java.lang.String getValue()
      Returns the value that the student's answer will be compared to using the Comparison assertion.
      double getWeight()
      Gets the weight of this author answer, i.e., the grad scored when an answer is correct according to the criteria contained in this author answer.
      void removeValidation(Validation validation)
      Removes a given validation from the set of validations in this author answer.

      Sets the type of comparison that will be used to compare the student's answer to getValue().

      Sets the value that the student's answer will be compared to using the Comparison assertion.
      void setWeight(double weight)
      Gets the weight of this author answer, i.e., the grad scored when an answer is correct according to the criteria contained in this author answer.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.wiris.quizzes.api.Serializable

        serialize

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        java.lang.String getValue()
        Returns the value that the student's answer will be compared to using the Comparison assertion.
        Returns:
        The correct answer value. It can be MathML, plain text or a graphical construction.

      • setValue

        void setValue(java.lang.String value)
        Sets the value that the student's answer will be compared to using the Comparison assertion.
        Parameters:
        value - The desired correct answer value. It can be MathML, plain text or a graphical construction.

      • setComparison

        Comparison setComparison(ComparisonName name)
        Sets the type of comparison that will be used to compare the student's answer to getValue().
        Parameters:
        name - The comparison name. If it is null or it is the current one, it does nothing.
        Returns:
        The comparison assertion that has been set. If the parameter is null returns null.

      • getComparison

        Comparison getComparison()
        Gets the comparison assertion that is to be used to compare the student's answer to getValue().
        Returns:
        The comparison assertion.

      • getValidations

        Validation[] getValidations()
        Gets the additional validation assertions that the student's answer must fulfill to be correct.
        Returns:
        An array containing the validation assertions. The array is a shallow copy of the actual one, meaning that the array object itself is new but its components are the actual objects being used in the implementation.

      • addNewValidation

        Validation addNewValidation(ValidationName name)
        Adds a new validation assertion that the student's answer has to fulfill in order to be correct.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the validation assertion to be added. If it is null or this validation already exists does nothing.
        Returns:
        The validation assertion added. If the parameter is null, it returns null. If the parameter already exists, returns the same as {getValidation(ValidationName)}.

      • getValidation

        Validation getValidation(ValidationName name)
        Get the validation assertion for a given validation type.
        Parameters:
        name - The desired validation type.
        Returns:
        The corresponding validation assertion. If this validation is not set in this author answer or the parameter is null, it returns null.

      • removeValidation

        void removeValidation(Validation validation)
        Removes a given validation from the set of validations in this author answer.
        Parameters:
        validation - The validation assertion to be removed. It must be the actual validation object from this author answer, it does not suffice for it to have the same type as the validation to be removed.

      • getWeight

        double getWeight()
        Gets the weight of this author answer, i.e., the grad scored when an answer is correct according to the criteria contained in this author answer.
        Returns:
        The weight of this author answer. It is a double between 0.0 (minimum score) and 1.0 (maximum score).

      • setWeight

        void setWeight(double weight)
        Gets the weight of this author answer, i.e., the grad scored when an answer is correct according to the criteria contained in this author answer.
        Parameters:
        weight - The desired weight. It must be a double between 0.0 (minimum score) and 1.0 (maximum score).
